claim: If no safety car period had occurred in the Australian Grand Prix where Lewis Hamilton made his debut, he would have scored fewer points.
extra_info: first race refers to min(Year); Lewis Hamiltonrefers to the full name of the driver; Full name of the driver refers to drivers.forename and drivers.surname;
reasoning: This is a counterfactual claim using 'If... had occurred... would have' language. It asks what would have happened under a hypothetical scenario (no safety car period). A database only records what actually happened, not what would have happened under different conditions. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from historical data, regardless of what information the database contains.

content.text:
Looking at this claim carefully before querying the database.

The claim says: "**If** no safety car period **had occurred**... he **would have** scored fewer points."

This is a classic counterfactual/hypothetical claim. It describes a "what if" scenario - what would have happened if conditions had been different (no safety car). The language "If... had occurred... would have" is textbook counterfactual phrasing.

A database records what actually happened, not what would have happened under hypothetical alternative conditions. Whether a safety car period affected the race outcome is speculative and cannot be determined from race results data alone.

Even if the database contained safety car information (which I can quickly check), it would only tell us that a safety car period *did* or *did not* occur - it cannot tell us what the results *would have been* without it.

```json
{"label": "NOT ENOUGH INFO", "reasoning": "This is a counterfactual claim using 'If... had occurred... would have' language. It asks what would have happened under a hypothetical scenario (no safety car period). A database only records what actually happened, not what would have happened under different conditions. Counterfactual claims cannot be verified from historical data, regardless of what information the database contains."}
```
